          text run at (0,0) width 319: "This is a table colspan counting problem (IMHO). "
          text run at (319,0) width 387: "The oversize <TABLE> has two rows: one has *two* <TD>"
          text run at (0,20) width 744: "\"requesting\" total of 3 columns to span; second row has *one* <TD> \"requesting\" total of 3 columns to span. In other"
          text run at (0,40) width 554: "words, it's asking for one more column than the max number of 'real' elements in a row. "
          text run at (553,40) width 200: "Here's the simple case (first one"
          text run at (0,60) width 256: "shows the problem; the other adjusts the "
          text run at (256,60) width 472: "colspan values and it works) (Dec 19 Nightly Win 95): All the elements in "
          text run at (727,60) width 20: "the"
          text run at (0,80) width 422: "two tables below are width=auto (i.e., no width attribute specified)."

      LayoutBlockFlow {P} at (0,656) size 769x80
        LayoutText {#text} at (0,0) size 758x79
          text run at (0,0) width 485: "The basic problem is \"competing colspan requests\". The table has two rows, "
          text run at (485,0) width 259: "both of which have COLSPAN requests."
          text run at (0,20) width 273: "They are both asking for one more column "
          text run at (273,20) width 485: "than the max number of 'real' elements in either row (i.e., both ask for total of"
          text run at (0,40) width 506: "5 but the maximum number of TD in either row is 4). This seems to confuse the "
          text run at (506,40) width 214: "algorithm. ;) (Note: all the column"
          text run at (0,60) width 504: "elements in these two tables are width=fixed except the TD with colspan=(4|3))."

              LayoutText {#text} at (2,2) size 27x19
                text run at (2,2) width 27: "blue"

              LayoutText {#text} at (2,2) size 23x19
                text run at (2,2) width 23: "that"
          LayoutTableRow {TR} at (0,28) size 678x24

      LayoutBlockFlow (anonymous) at (0,936) size 769x20
        LayoutBR {BR} at (0,0) size 0x19
